Pre-Game Insights: The Sacramento Kings are expected to perform better than their current season performance, with a 6-5 win-loss record but occupying the 10th spot in the Western Conference.
The Phoenix Suns, with a 9-2 win-loss record, are in second place in the Western Conference and have won eight of their last nine matches.
Phoenix Suns will be without KD for several games, including this match.
The Kings are struggling with injuries, with Malik Monk and Javon Carter out for this match.
Orlando Robinson is also out for the Kings due to a knee injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match is taking place in Sacramento, California.
The Suns are traveling for a back-to-back game after their NBA Emirates Cup debut the previous night.
